book.title: The Great Gatsby
book.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
book.description: A classic novel set in the Roaring Twenties, exploring themes of wealth, love, and the American Dream.

book.title: To Kill a Mockingbird
book.author: Harper Lee
book.description: A powerful story about racial injustice and moral growth, set in the American South during the 1930s.

book.author: George Orwell
book.description: A dystopian novel that explores the dangers of totalitarianism and the loss of individual freedoms.

book.title: Pride and Prejudice
book.author: Jane Austen
book.description: A classic romantic novel that satirizes societal expectations and explores themes of love and class.

book.title: The Catcher in the Rye
book.author: J.D. Salinger
book.description: A coming-of-age novel that follows the experiences of a disenchanted teenager in New York City.

book.title: Harry Potter
book.author: J.K. Rowling
book.description: The first book in the beloved fantasy series that follows the adventures of a young wizard, Harry Potter.

book.title: The Hobbit
book.author: J.R.R. Tolkien
book.description: A fantasy novel that serves as a prelude to the epic trilogy 'The Lord of the Rings,' featuring the adventures of Bilbo Baggins.

book.title: The Da Vinci Code
book.author: Dan Brown
book.description: A mystery thriller that explores art, religion, and secret societies, featuring the character Robert Langdon.

book.title: The Hunger Games
book.author: Suzanne Collins
book.description: A dystopian novel set in a post-apocalyptic world where teenagers are forced to participate in a televised survival competition.

book.title: The Hitchhiker's Guide
book.author: Douglas Adams
book.description: A comedic science fiction series that follows the misadventures of an unwitting human, Arthur Dent, as he travels through space.
